item.title: Help please?
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

Just make it save player count and allow prize to character file, then when you want to reset it under the initialize() method add:

if (playerCount >= 5) { playerCount = 0; allowPrize = true; }

Read full topic

item.title: Help please?
item.dc:creator: @_BBLLAARRGGHH __--BBLLAARRGGHH--__
item.description:
@_BBLLAARRGGHH wrote:

I’m trying to create a command that only works 5 times, until I reset it.
I have these

//santa hat lottery public int playerCount = 5; public boolean allowPrize; public void resetSanta() { playerCount = 0; } public void santaHat() { if (playerCount >= 5) { allowPrize = false; } else if (playerCount < 5) { allowPrize = true; } if (allowPrize = true) { addItem (995,15000000); playerCount++; } else if (allowPrize = false) { sendMessage("Not allowing Prizes right now!"); } }

if (cmd.startsWith("santahat")) { c.santaHat(); }
When I use the command, it works an unlimited amount of times, any help stopping it at 5?

Read full topic
